website_summaries.verdict: Waterproof and insulated rain boots that keep your feet dry and warm in all weather.
pros: Rubber and neoprene materials have plenty of flexibility so you can move freely
Boots extend high up the calf
Insulated materials are rated to keep your feet warm in temperatures down to -40°F
cons: Can be difficult to put on and take off

customer_reviews.title: They sent me USED BOOTS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Imagine having your son open up his $129 boots and finding dirt, dog hair, and worn down soles on the bottom. Yep, that's what happened. Today, on Christmas. Wonderful. It really stole the magic of the holiday to find your frickin' $129 boots have already been worn! Return label already printed and it's only 10:30am on Christmas morning. Would give zero stars, if possible.
customer_reviews.author: W. J. S.

customer_reviews.title: ... in the Alaska Wilderness and they are probably very good boots. However
customer_reviews.text: I saw people use these boots in the Alaska Wilderness and they are probably very good boots. However, the size seems to run small and the ones I ordered were way small, so I returned them. To get the proper fit I had to go to a retailer and try several pairs on. So make sure you try them on first. The sizing issue is the only reason that I did not rate them five stars.
customer_reviews.author: coolreed

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a size 11 in these and they are amazing comfortable. I can wear with or without socks ...
customer_reviews.text: I generally wear a 10/10.5, but have a "tall" foot and sometimes boots/shoes without laces are issue for me since my feet tend to feel squished from the top. I purchased a size 11 in these and they are amazing comfortable. I can wear with or without socks and my feet stay plenty warm. I've been living in these the last couple weeks since we've gotten nearly two feet of snow and temps have been in the single digits or low-teens. My feet have been comfortable whether I'm snowblowing, working in the garage, or just being outside. Great boots, would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Why Send Used?
customer_reviews.text: Overall I liked the boot. I'm just wondering why a brand new pair couldn't have been sent? I read another review where the boots were opened on Christmas Day and they were used! That's not good business practice but I was willing to try Boggs based on its reputation. Now I'm sorry I did; the money wasn't a factor but if I'm going to spend almost $100 for anything, I would like it to be brand new. Wish you all well...
customer_reviews.author: Kresiva3

customer_reviews.title: Sizeing!!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to replace a pair of 7 year old BOGS Rancher Size 11. They still fit great no leaks but soles all worn out. Went with the Bogs Classic Winter boot Size 11. Boot arrived in 2 days looked great, niece sole, couldn't wait to try on " WRONG" I couldn't get either foot to go half way in, impossible to put on no way. Had to return, could have reordered, size 12 , or 13 but then my feet would be to small for the boot. Went and ordered the Rancher size 11 and hope they fit, don't understand the sizeing I had. So beware when ordering may have to go up in size or change style.
customer_reviews.author: JMFEZZ

customer_reviews.title: Best of their kind for the price
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE. While house sitting I "borrowed" my buddys pair and fell in love. I wear these in public and got no shame in my game. But 4/5 and not 5 is because the left feels a half size smaller than the right. Maybe a bad batch but I'm gonna wear them in till it works. I'm sure they have an amazing return policy but all boots, even neoprene and rubber, have a break in period. And I should also add the traction in mud, sand and on the street is phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: alex vahtras

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long
customer_reviews.text: I debated if I really wanted to spend the money for this type of boot, can they really be warm? Well I finally did it and bought a pair. They came in two days, the week before the big freeze the last week of January 2019. These boots are great, comfortable, warm without being hot. they keep my feet dry for snow blowing and shoveling. Easy to step in to the take the dog out. I wish I would have bought a pair of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, order a size up.
customer_reviews.text: The Bogs Classic Highs are great boots. These are my second pair. My last pair lasted 3 years of hard use and they had lots of miles. The new pair seems like they will perform the same. These boots aren’t something I wear when it’s really cold below 10 degrees and I’m not moving much. If I’m able to walk I’m fine. These aren’t ice fishing boots or for long sits in a tree stand during the late season. But are perfect for being mobile during cold, wet weather. They’re totally waterproof and very comfortable. Order a size up for thicker socks. Everyone in my family has a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Rick DIY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at quite a few pairs of Muck and Lacrosse boots and I am happy I decided to go with these Bogs. Great quality boot, easy on/off, waterproof, and the wedge on the back helps tremendously with taking them off without getting all full of mud. Used these bad boys for snow blowing all winter in Wisconsin and they kept me warm the whole time, every time. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Marose

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised by the comfort
customer_reviews.text: I really like the construction of these, having never owned this style of boot I wasn't sure what to expect. I was surprised by the neoprene material continuing into the foot / toe area of the boot it was very comfortable for something that has such rugged rubber on the outside. I haven't worn these out into the elements yet, but just waring them around the house to get a feel for them I can tell they are going to be comfortable and very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased at great price- was looking for Bog and grabbed at amazing Amazon price Boots are durable and serve its waterproof function. Need to dry on boot dryer otherwise will never dry the condensation that builds up in boots. As mentioned before we are repeat Bog customers and will be for growing feet in our family
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!
customer_reviews.text: A pair of rubber boots that actually fits me and are what they say they are.... Just put them through a weekend of felling trees and homestead maintenance in rainy 30+ degree weather with slippery as snot mud. The ground is so saturated that you can hear every step you take. My feet stayed warm and dry the entire weekend. Love these boots. I'll warn you though, they get hot much above 40 degrees......
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: there awesome boots and they fit my feet perfect i stay ...
customer_reviews.text: bought these for feeding cattle and working out in the cold, well bottom of my feet froze in them with pair of under armour socks on, so i got me a pair of muck boots, there awesome boots and they fit my feet perfect i stay nice and warm in them...UPDATE, not only are bottom of my feet cold but the heels about two inches up cracked,( where your foot bends when u walk) also happen with another pair i bought of lacrosse boots, the money u spend on them they should last couple years i would think
customer_reviews.author: MAN IN BLACK

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot if You Don't Have Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: Very well made boot with warm removable insoles. Can be replaced with superfeet insoles e.g. grey warm merino. Lack of half sizes and wide sizes is problematic for those of us with wide feet. I wear 9.5 W shoes - tried 11 size boots with thick socks and standard insole - still too tight and a size 12 would halve been far too long. The other design issue that might be an issue is that the sole has rather shallow grooves compared with vibrant soles boots and may lack grip.
customer_reviews.author: Shipdoc

customer_reviews.title: Seem like they're good
customer_reviews.text: Wear a 10.5-11 and ordered a 11. They fit as I expected them too - good with thick socks. No feedback on the durability, but the top half of the boot is neoprene similar to waders. Hoping they'll prove to be a good buy over the next year or so Update: After wearing them through numerous swamps all spring/summer, they're comfortable and waterproof. Would buy again in a heart beat Update II: Two years and they're going strong. Buy em'
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: These are the best boots as they are very warm, but light. My husband needed them to work on the farm. He wore out the old ones before winter wore out. We couldn't find them anywhere around and were so happy to find just what we needed here and they were delivered even more quickly than we expected. They actually came a day early. My husband called me to tell me he was wearing them as he had gotten them from the UPS driver outside and put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Much larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Much larger than expected. Not only in the foot area, but the leg portion is enormous. My leg is skinny for sure, but it could probably fit in there twice. I wear a size 12 for all shoes/boots and so that's what I bought. Many of the descriptions said that these would be "true to size" and that just wasn't my experience. The space for the foot was about a half size larger than I needed and the leg is swimming in extra space and my leg moves around a lot, even with a thick wool sock and my pant leg stuffed inside the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son to wear to the Chiefs playoff game. It started at 15 degrees tailgate. He took his boots off before the game to put on toe warmers and I kid you not, his feet were steaming. They stayed warm the whole game. Awesome tread as well and completely waterproof. Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Woody

customer_reviews.title: Solid Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are solid just like everyone else has pointed out. Fit quite well and feel that I can go a whole day with them on. I think you do need to wear socks to keep yourself warm (they are not going to keep you warm on their own). If there is any ding - and it's more aesthetic than functional - then it's the sole - it's flat (not the inside but the sole) with this strange sole pattern. Other than that - good solid shoe which i am very glad I got.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Incredible.
customer_reviews.text: These are seriously fantastic. They are slightly small, I usually wear a men's 10.5 and thought the 11 would be fine. It is, but my toes touched with socks on. I was worried I'd have to return them but gave them a shot and it's actually worked out quite well. They seem to have fit to my feet and I no longer notice the toe rub. I live in Michigan and these boots have been great for the winter. I can stand outside for hours (which I do frequently watching the kids play) and my feet are toasty warm with normal socks on. They're easy to slip on and off, clean up nice, and are definitely waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: These boots are just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: First off, I did not review the arch support because I wear custom orthotic inserts due to a case of plantar fasciitis and removed the insoles immediately. The ability to actually remove the insoles is a huge deal for people like me. The other aspects of these boots that I am happy with are the construction (top notch), form fitting foot area (my feet kind of thunk into them and they never slide around) and there is a small lug on the heel of each boot that facilitates removal (my last pair by another very well known manufacturer lacked these). All in all a great, high quality boot.
customer_reviews.author: BrianA

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfy, Not Tall Enough
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of boggs and the lacrosse boots at the same time. I use my boots for everything outdoors from hunting, scouting, shed hunting, ice fishing, etc. I had one pair of muck boots for the last 6 years and was kind of partial too them, but had heard boggs were comfy so figured I would try them out. They were very comfy but being the tall edition I expected them to be as tall or taller than muck or lacrosse boots but they weren't and Ive had water come over the top of my mucks so i sent the boggs back.
customer_reviews.author: Galen

customer_reviews.title: Warm & waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my fiancé and he wore them for the first time shoveling a wet, icy snowfall. Besides being warm & comfortable, they come up all the way to the knee, keeping snow out of the boot. The tread is solid and grippy, so no slipping on the ice, and he was able to use the heel of the boots to break up the hard lumps of snow the plow left. These are seriously great boots - totally worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Aranyosi

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: While fixing the pump in the elevator shafts at work this afternoon my feet stayed warm and dry. The water was calf deep and as you can see from the pictures my pant legs are dry as well. If your in the construction industry in the Pacific Northwest I would have to say they are well worth the investment. Local 271 Eugene Carpenters I can afford Muck Boots however Bogs are equally matched up at half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: What I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear while moving snow. It's usually quite cold and I don't move around as I'm on a tractor with no cab. I was warm and dry with these boots. My feet have always felt cold. Not so with these. I am quite pleased. The only problem I had was the size of the opening. I have rather large calves and I had to wear my jeans outside the boots as there was no room left. There was clearance so they did not rub my calf, but if I had to go through deep water, I would have felt differently. I bought these for warmth and they are warm.
customer_reviews.author: S. S.

customer_reviews.title: Bogs are the PERFECT boots for Alaska!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my son. They are the best boot for Alaskan Fall/Winter/Spring weather. He lives in these boots from September through April, mud, rain and snow (plus they are rated to -40 degrees, a perfect winter boot). They are super durable, and I purchase them a size & 1/2 larger so that he may wear them for 2 years. I buy nothing but "Bogs" for him, they are totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Busy907Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for my husband. He has a size 11.5 foot and the 12 fit perfectly. They are extremely well made and comfortable per husband. They have already been tested in mud and water which he found to keep his feet dry. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Gray

customer_reviews.title: Best mutli-purpose boots I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my boots for the last 6 months. From fall fishing on river banks, to deer hunting, to ice fishing. Overall the boots are great, and totally worth the price. I have them 4 out of 5 stars because I expected them to be a little warmer than they are. When ice fishing in 20-30 degree weather they start to get cold agreed 2-3 hours. So I recommend throwing on some thick socks if you'll be standing around in the winter. If you're walking they are very toasty warm in any weather.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Really not a good purchase for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for working at a meat cutting plant. I habe never had a mire slippery boot in my life. Cant hardly stand up in them in wet cement floors. Also there is literally no arch support. Very unhappy with my choice. By far, not nearly as good as the old Columbia rubber boots they replaced
customer_reviews.author: Trail Master

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with these boots!! 1) They don't keep your feet warm! The temp was 20° out and my feet froze with 2 heavy pairs of socks! 2) These are not good winter boots! I used them for hunting and was walking on a small grassy slope that had an inch of snow on it and I slid several times. I actually twisted my back because I was worried about dropping my gun when I slid. Everyone's reviews seemed really good so I thought I would give them a try and I wish I didn't!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: ... a size 9 so I ordered a 10 fit good a little narrow but I do have a wide ...
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews first before I ordered and I wear a size 9 so I ordered a 10 fit good a little narrow but I do have a wide foot but not to bad as to return them. Overall good for 89.00 dollars way cheaper than the implement store near by there’s were 125.00.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run a little bit small
customer_reviews.text: Like the boots. Seem a little small but unfortunately they don't have half sizes and a full size bigger would be way too much!
customer_reviews.author: christopher c. benchek

customer_reviews.title: BOGS are the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Bogs are excellent all weather boots if you get the insulated variety. Our son wears them all the time. We purchased these through Amazon from OutlandUSA.com. Everything was perfect and I will purchase these boots again and again. I would also purchase from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: LGM

customer_reviews.title: -40 Really?
customer_reviews.text: Good looks, water proof, however the -40 rating is overrated. My feet were frozen solid at 37above in a dry barn with wool socks on. Not a winter boot. I went by the other raters, one of which bought a few pairs for an Antartic expedition? Really? This boot would not cut it in the Maine Northwoods trust me.
customer_reviews.author: ALEX C

customer_reviews.title: They kept my feet comfortable while active
customer_reviews.text: I wore those boots on a construction site through the brutal winter in 2013-2014. They kept my feet comfortable while active, in temperatures down to -17. I have also worn them in the field for hunting for the past year in nice dry comfort. One nice feature of these boots is that the boot itself is not overly bulky, making it a nice safe boot for climbing into a tree stand using metal stand ladders and climbing sticks. My boots have held up well over time and the soles have not worn excessively. I would certainly consider buying another pair to replace these one day.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Good boots but can irritate ankle.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my fiancé who does snow removal. So he needs durable boots. He had a pair of bogs for the past three years but they finally fell apart. He likes this pair but for some reason the ankle on the right boot is rubbing really hard and irritating him through two pairs of socks. He weighs 140lbs so I know they aren’t too tight. Just something about how they are made. Besides that he doesn’t have any complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my husband and thank God they had a ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my husband and thank God they had a size that fit. Rarely can we find a size 17 he just loves them they are comfortable and warm too .He took them hunting ,we received them in less than a week thank you Bogs for Having them ready . These are the perfect boot for rain , mud , swamps They're warm and very durable l Would definitely buy them again and again. We lost his first pair
customer_reviews.author: K M

customer_reviews.title: Trust me when I say a product is good
customer_reviews.text: I only leave a review if I strongly believe in something and these boots gained my respect. Pros 1- lightweight but durable and well insulated. I tried them in snow, rain and slush. 2- fits like a glove and you can easily bend your feet. 3- good arch support, which makes them very comfortable in extended use times. Cons 1- runs small. I ordered a size 8 but had to return them and get size 9. I have never worn size 9 shoes in my life. 9 fits great and just enough room for this socks when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Yassir Obeid

customer_reviews.title: Instep
customer_reviews.text: The instep at the tongue area is very narrow. If you can get your foot in, try getting it out. I can't use mine because of this reason so I gave them to my grandson who has smaller feet and thinner ankles. If you have a high instep I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Luis MacGregor

customer_reviews.title: No problems with sizing for me
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots, as all of the other reviews say. I just wanted to say that the fit is fine, they did not run small for me at all like the other reviews warn. I am a 10.5. The other reviews said to order a FULL size big. They don't have 11.5, so I didn't know whether to get a 11 (just a half size big) or a 12 (1.5 size big). I got the 11 and surprise it fit exactly as I would expect of an 11. For me, no size issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: RSKZ

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son and he loves them. He has said several times that they are the best boots he has ever worn. He has a high arch and instep and these are easy to get on and off and are comfortable with adequate support. I also appreciate that Bogs has large sizes because shoe selection is pretty limited for his giant feet. I decided to get a pair of Bogs for him after I got a pair last year and love them. Will definitely continue buying Bogs when boots are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: My Third Pair of Bogs
customer_reviews.text: These boots work very well for me. They are very warm. I wear them to work in around my muddy greenhouses in cooler months. They also become my snow boots in winter. Snug fit in the beginning but they form to your foot in short order. I've been pleased with them and will continue to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie T

customer_reviews.title: True to Size
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about the size after reading some reviews, but decided to order a size 10 for my husband (he is size 10). The boots fit perfectly and my husband really liked his Father's day gift. Now he is ready to work outside.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Warm, fits snugly
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these boots for doing outside work in freezing temps. He usually wears a 10.5 and says the 11 is comfortable snug on his foot. He is not able to wear extra pairs of socks like he normally would but the boot is rated for -40* so hopefully he won't have too this winter!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots. I use them for hunting. My feet are a little wide. I wear a size 10 and ordered appropriately. It was a little tight at first but took some breaking in. They are my favorite boots now. Warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Hunting Boot
customer_reviews.text: My husband was wearing muks but having foot pain afterward. After reading reviews I got him these. They are much better and do not hurt his feet. They are a little too tight on the calf area since outdoorsman tuck their pants into the top of the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Mama T

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and function.
customer_reviews.text: The boots are warm, waterproof and comfortable with a mid weight sock. Incredible grip in the snow conditions I've had here in Buffalo, NY. Can not say a bad thing about them. Easy pull on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Goose184

customer_reviews.title: my feet love these and so does my house
customer_reviews.text: I love tramping around in these while dog walking in a very messy, cold environment. They have been hard to get off and on, and were starting to give me a blister so I didn't wear them for a few days, and now we're best friends again. I live very far north, and have waded into the Arctic Ocean, my feet stay dry and warm. Women's Bogs were always too narrow for me, I could only wear them for a few minutes, but the men's work much better for my wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hurell

customer_reviews.title: My sons favorite "swamper"
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old son had me order these after trying on the brand for the first time at a local store. Has had Muck and Lacrosse previously and he states these are much more comfortable and he likes the tread and the way the tread wraps up around his foot and is not as "flat."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm
customer_reviews.text: These Bog boots are a life saver in winter conditions. I bought because I live in a rugged climate and harsh winters. Found out that these are also wonderful to use during rain, doing yard work, etc. They are comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Happy purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Still new, but I believe these will work great on snowy days and dog walks in the woods. I bought a size up, as others suggested, and I always put an insert in boots. They are fitting great. I also wear thick socks with them. Without thick socks and insert, I would have preferred my exact size. I like the high boot, and they are easy to slide on and off, which may be due to the up-size. I wear an 8, bought a 9.
customer_reviews.author: Liam D Esteppe

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for roaming around my 12 acre property of wild grasses and dirt and sand. They are comfortable and warm and keep my feet dry. I am happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Decorator Girl

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband. It fits well and the package came quickly in good condition. Not sure whether it is good for the winter or not since it is not cold yet. This is to replace his old LL Bean winter boots.
customer_reviews.author: ma2011

customer_reviews.title: I assure you that any boot that can make it thru my two boys are great boots.
customer_reviews.text: My sons have been wearing these Classic Bogs for nearly all of their lives. The are 11 and 13 now and every time that I try and steer them towards another style I get push back from them. I have given in now and ONLY buy this boot for them. The will wear them until the are just too small for their feet and they are completly worn out...I usually buy new for the older one and he hands them down to the younger one. I assure you that any boot that can make it thru my two boys are great boots.
customer_reviews.author: DRW

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought some cheap boots at first. Luckily they sent the wrong size. I thought it was crazy to spend this much on boots. After comparing these to the cheaper ones though, I have to say these are way better. They feel like shoes with actual arch support. The cheap ones were just as expected. If you want quality, these are the ones for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I appreciate the large size !!
customer_reviews.text: It is not easy to find anything to fit a growing boy, had to order a size 17 to get it on him ! I appreciate the quality footwear in the larger sizes, his feet need support - still growing. Love the tread on the bottom, for non slip use in snow & mud. Thanks !
customer_reviews.author: Ness

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far
customer_reviews.text: I've only used them to walk my dog, but the streets are flooded with 4" of water and slushy snow, they've kept my feet warm. It's only been on the 30's but I'm sure they will keep my feet warm at colder temps. Is a little movement in the heel, and I can wear bigger socks, ordered the size I normally wear. Great product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Black

customer_reviews.title: Nice & toasty
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time,fit real nice,I have fat feet & capsulitus,no problem on &off,really nice & warm on the feet. Tested in Alaska visiting my Daughter.
customer_reviews.author: arr

customer_reviews.title: Stellar boot
customer_reviews.text: Buy the size you wear & if you are a half size go up a size. These are great boots and I recommend if you need a sturdy chore type of boot.
customer_reviews.author: dawnnoel

customer_reviews.title: Boots were clearly used.
customer_reviews.text: The boots I received were used. They still had dirt on the sides and soles. The soles also had obvious wear on them. I saw another review that stated the same thing before making my purchase, but assumed that it was an isolated issue. I do not recommend buying these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Irina Dikov

customer_reviews.title: Narrow, Tight Fit with a VERY Wide Top
customer_reviews.text: I don't think they fit as well as the Mucks I used to own, but if they last longer then I will be happy. I decided to support the Bogs company because they stand by their product with a lifetime warranty. I'm not a big fan of the extremely wide top on these boots. It makes it easier to just step into the boot and walk out the door, but when walking in the woods. I frequently have to stop and clear things out of the boot that have fallen in through the top.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for wet and snowy weather
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for wet and snowy weather. Used mainly for shoveling the driveway, they keep my feet and now my son's feet warm and dry. They are pretty basic and not cushioned.
customer_reviews.author: Sargent Mama

customer_reviews.title: Northern Minnesota approved
customer_reviews.text: Gave to husband for Christmas. He usually wears a 12. Got a 13 just incase as he has a wider toe box. Fits perfectly. His feet are now dry and warm. Not a super heavy boot which is nice. We live in Minnesota so they are true tested for cold.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Parker

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm and Dry
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. He is REALLY hard on mud boots and needs something that can keep his foot warm and dry. These boots hold up extremely well (much better than the Muck boots I have for my older son!). Very sturdy and well made. Very warm. We love them.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!  Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: After dealing with rubber boots that were purchased at a nearby store, these boots were a welcome relief to my boyfriend. The cushioning, the protection, and the absorbency are all what was needed!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Thiel

customer_reviews.title: Still not bad and maybe they will stretch the more I wear ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have bought a size larger. My feet take a wide but from the reviews I crossed my fingers and ordered the size I normally order in a wide width. Still not bad and maybe they will stretch the more I wear them as I haven't put but maybe 1/2 mile on them. I like the light weight and tread.
customer_reviews.author: South Cackalacky Jim

customer_reviews.title: Fit well, dry, and warm
customer_reviews.text: Solid boots for wet cold weather. Good arch support for rubber boots descent traction in the muck.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Comfortable, good quality, and keep my feet warm. Would definitely buy again, prefer these over the artic boots
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, warm, dry and fit good
customer_reviews.text: Our 13yr old son.loves these boots..so does his dad and older brother. When he cam't find them its bc someone in our house has swiped them. He had muck brand before and kept complaining his feet were cold in our crazy michigan weather. Well not no more always warm and dry..no more complaings
customer_reviews.author: Family of 7

customer_reviews.title: Durable and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my sons feet warm and dry. Have several pairs and they are great. Very durable good quality
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Versatile boots
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses these all year long. They are great for shoveling snow and he also uses them when working outside in wet conditions. He wears a 10 1/2 in a sneaker and we bought these in a US 11. He loves them. (We did return a Bogs boot that I bought at DSW in a shorter height. The classic high waterproof insulated rain boot is the best!)
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Really waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. We do lots of winter hikes out in the snow. He is very please with the ease of putting them on as well as the warmth they provide and the waterproof feature. He wore them hunting and his feet stayed dry when crossing moist hay fields, where other boots he owns leaves him with wet toes. He also wore these in to our pond up to one inch from the top of the boot and came out with 100% dry feet! He was impressed and he is one picky guy when it comes to footwear.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfTwo

customer_reviews.title: Great expedition boot for cold water zodiac landings
customer_reviews.text: I wore these on an expedition cruise in Alaska, where we had to exit zodiacs onto rough rocky beaches through shallow water. They kept my feet dry all day, and were comfortable enough to wear while hiking. They appear to have virtually zero wear after 10 days of heavy use, so I suspect I will use them for decades.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I used this boot for portages in a week long canoe excursion. It will not let water in, period. Unfortunately, this means that once water gets in, it wont let water out either. Campfires, open sun, lots and lots of hot dry socks... Nothing would get the wet out of the boot while in the field. If i didn't have great socks i would have had miserable feet. Update: Still going strong after two years. They are amazing if you don't step into too deep of water.
customer_reviews.author: BuysFromAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for snow or rain
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the first pair (now more than 5 years old). They got a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought property and are building a house through the winter, and these have easily been my best purchase. They slip on and off easily but stay on my feet snugly. I'm often trudging through mud in 30-40o weather, and my feet are always warm and dry. I only wish they came in half sizes. I normally wear 10.5 but went with 10. They're a bit more snug than what would be ideal, but I tried on the 11 in a store and they felt too big and loose on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Ocker

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I have found
customer_reviews.text: Best boots I have ever had I would recommend these boots to anyone great out in the field checking horses even when it was -50 outside love these boots will order another pair when I need to
customer_reviews.author: Alfie mohr

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many pair of Muck boots but this is my go to boot from now on. Much lighter than Muck and built very well. The tread on bottom is great. I wear 10.5 to 11D in boots and bought these in 11. Fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie T.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Husband was very pleased with his boots...he's always been sold on the Boggs brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Son loved them
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my son. They fit perfectly and he said they felt very comfortable. No word on how they work in the wet as he just got them...
customer_reviews.author: Aleecee

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Wore for 2 days and they tore. Would never own a pair again. Cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe at a fair price in BIG sizes
customer_reviews.text: My son wears a size 16 wide shoe, and it’s nearly impossible to find a slip on boot that he can get into. We took a chance and ordered a size 17, since these don’t come in a wide, and they fit perfectly. He loves these boots, and he will get a lot of use out of them doing field work for his Wildlife Management courses at college.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Shiflet

customer_reviews.title: They are a comfortable winter work boot.  Especially in Oregon
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable and are perfect for our wet winters
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots. Knocked off a star because they run ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Knocked off a star because they run small. I'm a 10.5, bought an 11 and they're tight. Otherwise boots keep water out, have good traction, look good and are warm.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Better than a pac boot.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to try these! I'm in Indiana where it was raining last week and tornados tore up the county. Today it is 16 degrees and dry. These boots handle it all with comfort. Although they may not be the best choice for sitting in a tree stand for hours, if you are moving around, your feet will be warm and dry, period. No half sizes are not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Good product, fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these boots last winter. I probably used them about 10 or 15 times since I purchased them. Though relatively new the strap on one of the boot pulled off after these few uses. This tore the top of the boot. I sent a picture to bogs and they immediately replaced the pair. The boots are tough and work well, fit well but the customer service is paramount.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace H. Cole III

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for somebody else as a gift. They are very happy with these boots, not only they look good but they are nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: The One

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: love wearing these boots they are soft and your feet dont stink.
customer_reviews.author: hector gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: favorite brand of boots for farm work
customer_reviews.text: same boot one year ago and the price has doubled? was going to buy again - i guess not ...I bought these boots for 60.00 , how can they double in a year -
customer_reviews.author: sasshorse

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Use them for hunting & snow removal. Using thick socks in the winter so order a size or 2 up.
customer_reviews.author: Zita k.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Just got these are few months ago and they already have holes and my feet get wet
customer_reviews.author: ttbell

customer_reviews.title: The fit is great
customer_reviews.text: Haven't wore them yet. But tried on as soon as I got them and fit was great. Enough room to wear thick socks with
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bogs camo waterproof boots
customer_reviews.text: Boot seems well made looks great. Boot was smaller than expected. Went based off of dimensions that said a 10 would fit should have went with an 11.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: So comfy
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my hubby and I want a pair so bad now! I steal them for things around the house. They are way more durable than I thought they would be and super comfy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a size up.
customer_reviews.text: Good boots, just sized too small. I've been a size 12 for 20 years, tried on 12's in a store and they were snug, bought 13's and still too small so I sent them back. Other than sizing issue they are a great boot and I like the larger size Inhave now.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: got them sooner than expected and used them on the weekend hunt. Now if only the deer were as cooperative... I wear 14W but ordered 15 and fits great. Lighter weight then the boots i had been using for years and so much quicker and easier on and off than any boots i've used.
customer_reviews.author: Ken R

customer_reviews.title: If you want warm feet this is what you need
customer_reviews.text: I have no dislikes with this product they are amazing, I work on a farm an these boots are the best for winter pretty good traction an your feet stay warm an dry for the most part some times they keep you a little to warm an it causes you to sweat
customer_reviews.author: Chuckie b

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Much more comfortable than expected and quality is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Badstad

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Been using these 5x a week at work for over a year now and they are very well made! Pretty comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Not slip resistant.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have with these boots so far, is that they are not as slip resistant as advertised! I work in meat processing, so I'm constantly walking on wet, slick surfaces. Add a little fat or grease into that and it's game over. So I'm not a fan of the fact that they claim that these do well on wet surfaces. They do not.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton

product_meta.title: Bogs Mens Classic High No Handle Waterproof Insulated Rain and Winter Snow Boot
product_meta.description:
Bog's Classic High waterproof boot features a form-fitting upper and treaded outsole for a steady step in wet conditions.

Urban and outdoor enthusiasts love Bogs. Always waterproof and warm, they walk comfortably, breathe naturally and combine modern style with rugged construction. Both the popular classics and the new MT series are available with waterproof breathable uppers. Everything we sell is backed with a 100% satisfaction guarantee. Enjoy.
feature_bullets: Natural hand-lasted rubber and a four way stretch inner bootie
Contour fit for maximum support and movement
Comfort rated from temperate to -40˚F or sub-zero conditions
